website_summaries.verdict: A wireless and piercingly loud theft deterrent with additional clever applications.
pros: This 113-decibel wireless alarm is triggered via vibration, tilt, or remote from up to 20 meters away
Boasts 7 different sensitivity levels, 6 unique ringtones, and a IP5 waterproof polycarbonate shell
It can pair to 8 different remotes and even works in the home on doors and windows
cons: The double-sided installation sticker may not hold up well over time

customer_reviews.title: One Major Flaw.....
customer_reviews.text: When you arm this alarm on your bike and a thief moves it, it makes a "chirp". This tells the thief "Hey, there's an alarm. Look for it, clip the zip ties, and smash it". IMO it should sound instantly like a car alarm. No warning! I cannot recommend this alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Sarge M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome alarm, only negative that comes to mind is ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome alarm, only negative that comes to mind is the remote range is limited to a few feet Installed it under the hood of an older car to discourage an inconsiderate neighbor from parking by Braille. Working so far according to the lack of fresh marks on my bumper.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Abrahamson

customer_reviews.title: Total piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I could tell the minute I took the box from the UPS guy that this was a total piece of crap. It's so lightweight it can't possibly provide adequate 4 season protection. It has no beefed up panels to deal with hot mufflers. It barely covers my Honda Nighthawk from front to back. It's a total loser. It's going back as soon as I order/receive a cover that can adequately protect my bike. AVOID at ALL COSTS.
customer_reviews.author: Smilin Sam

customer_reviews.title: Hopes dashed!
customer_reviews.text: As I took it out of the package, I inadvertently pressed a button... and WOW. Ear splittingly loud, much to my satisfaction. Unfortunately, that was the high point of the experience. Try as I might, I could not get the device to work. It would not connect to the remote for any programming purposes, and the alarm never sounded again. I did get some lights, but no sound. I read the somewhat awkwardly worded directions. I attempted a reset, but nothing worked. As I removed the battery to reset the device (as explained in the instructions), I was struck by the very flimsy, near-disposable feel of the electronics. It never worked. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine stater

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I’ve ever made.
customer_reviews.text: Talked to a homeless guy downtown today that asked me about this alarm... why? Because he’s seen it go off three times this week when someone has tried to steal my bike. All three times the thieves have scattered. Lock it up, activate this alarm and you’ve secured it about as much as you can. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Miller

customer_reviews.title: second review-  dead after about 2 months ,
customer_reviews.text: update- Loved this alarm, then it died several months later. replaced the batteries and the thing went haywire. The alarm would go off and you then get a steady noice and it doesn't shut off. Ashame , I really liked it when it worked.. old report ====I do not attach directly to my bike because i use several bikes. I place it in the little pouches I have on the bike. I think it will act as a great bike theft deterrent. It is extremely loud and easy to lock and unlock.
customer_reviews.author: John Leer

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL.
customer_reviews.text: I have a $2500 Ebike. I found this alarm and IT WORKS GREAT!!! The alarm coupled with my state of the art bike lock I feel safer about leaving it for a short period of time. The concern of one of the reviewers about the alarm not going off in full force as soon as bike is touched, I want to tell them this. Get a bike lock. By the time a thief gets to removing the lock, the alarm is loud and in full alert mode. It would have been smart if when the alarm goes off it would send a notification to my phone. Face it for the price this is awesome item that works.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff jackson

customer_reviews.title: BUY 2 Well Worth it....
customer_reviews.text: I used 2 alarms with 1 remote by following Jesse's directions....PERFECT...HOWEVER, the FIRST thing you do is throw away the cheap (1cent) Phillips screwdriver because it WILL ruin the tiny screws in the remote: and then you're screwed (pun intended! lol) I bought 2 units because as some have already said, someone can hear and look for the sound, and find it immediately. With 2 units, one under the seat and one in a bag on the front, the sound is great and it's hard to tell WHERE it's coming from. The seller should send me a free one re this review....lol I think it's (they) a great bike alarm theft deterrent! My ebike is worth $28....100 times over.....
customer_reviews.author: JFD

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: This device came package well and ready to install. Installation using double sided tape is quick and easy. Other options like Velcro or cable ties can be used as well. The disturbance chirp feature is a nice function to influence vandals to move along. If the disturbance continues then the full alarm makes enough racket to hopefully deter thieves. It would be nice if more than one alarm unit could be paired with one remote. Placement of the alarming devices at various or hard to access locations will make it tougher for vandals to damage the unit(s) when sounding. These units are priced reasonably low considering other options on the market.
customer_reviews.author: chobbs42

customer_reviews.title: Activation and Deactivation volume is WAY TOO LOUD
customer_reviews.text: The activation and deactivation noises scare my dog and hurt my ears. I bought this because of the glowing reviews, but the activation/deactivation noise is a deal breaker for me. (Writing this one star review so that (1) folks can comment IF there is a way to turn that waaaay down (2) folks who have sensitive ears can steer clear.)
customer_reviews.author: Jason and Quincy

customer_reviews.title: Works well and hard to beat the price
customer_reviews.text: As long as you are not expecting Viper like features then this will work just fine as a low cost deterrent. Installation could not be easier by simply placing under the seat or tail section. For me it was under my seat. I did replace the factory batteries with better Duracell version in both the alarm itself and remote. I have forgotten about the alarm a few times causing me to definitely be startled once it gave me the warning alarm while trying to remove the motorcycle cover. Couple this with other hardware security components for the motorcycle and it's a good deterrent package.
customer_reviews.author: Help-Me-Help-You

customer_reviews.title: Using as cat deterrent on custom blinds and so happy!!
customer_reviews.text: My cats wouldn't stop messing up my custom blinds and nothing would stop them -- double-stick tape, aluminum foil, spritzing water on them, scolding them. I put up drapes in one room and pinned the middle together and they just pushed them aside. Well I put one of these against the blinds in one room and another brand in the other. They set one off one morning around 6:30 and they haven't messed with the blinds since! I occasionally beep it to disarm and rearm it just to remind them it's there.
customer_reviews.author: Some random IT guy

customer_reviews.title: A cheap deterrent for an expensive investment
customer_reviews.text: Look, no motorcycle come with a built in alarm system unless you wanna pay BMW $16k. I live in an area where people bust the bikes locks, chains, and wheel out away. But the main thing is, they do it because no one can see them or hear them. This alarm is not meant to scare theives away or stop them from trying to take your bike, but what it will do is wake you and everyone else up at 2am when the thieves are messing around with your ride. The thieves are going to try and take your bike, this alarm will let the neighborhood know so at least someone knows to take action
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good remote
customer_reviews.text: Had to use a slightly different method than listed to get mine to pair, but it none the less works fine. Has a very good range and the fob is nice and sturdy with firm buttons. The battery seems to be lasting for now, will see in 6 months or so. For now it's a good purchase for Genie garage door openers. Update: after about 6 months of very little use since I have this setup on my motorcycle it totally died. I noticed it wasn't arming so I tried changing the battery but didn't do anything. The remote and alarm both died in 6 months so for $20 I guess that's not too awful.
customer_reviews.author: Epillon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This unit works great. It is sensitive and very loud.
customer_reviews.author: Michael James Littlefield

customer_reviews.title: Super cheap! Does it’s job 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: I mainly used this to scare off anyone lurking around my motorcycle. I have issues in my neighborhood of crackheads wandering around. For the price I believe everyone should have one of these. Just in case
customer_reviews.author: Honest guy

customer_reviews.title: Normally don't leave reviews but ...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much from this little thing, just thought it would be a cheap alarm to use for my bike, wasn't too worried about it being garbage. Very surprised by the quality. And it is waaaaaay louder than I thought it was. Really cool sounding alarm too. Can't speak for the longevity because I just got it but the plastic quality is decent, doesn't "feel" super cheap. Good job Wsdcam, I think I'll be buying some more and putting alarms on everything now :P
customer_reviews.author: Reasonablereviewer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but sensitivity needs adjusting
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for use on my sport bike, and it's super easy to use. However, the sensitivity of the unit seems to change after you install it. Not sure if it's something I'm doing wrong, but it goes off as soon as you touch it when it's just sitting on the counter, but seems to not want to go off without significant motion on the bike. It does go off if you sit on it and move it much, but I'd like it to go off before someone actually gets on the bike.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: My unique use
customer_reviews.text: Bought a inflatable Santa to put outside. I have had things stolen in the past so I thought I would attach this alarm to it. You can use the self stick that comes with it but I chose to use a my lock tie and have turn it on and tested it with a medium setting. It was easy to attach and once I set it up I adjusted it as if someone was trying to steal my Santa. Sure enough it went off and because it is right in front of my window the alarm was very loud. All I can hope for is that it will deter anyone from moving him away
customer_reviews.author: Richard B. Barnaby

customer_reviews.title: Good idea. Just requires some attention
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product, but not perfect. Pay close Attention to how you set it up including where you mounted it can be overly sensitive at times and other times not activate nothing is more annoying than having a piercing alarm go off just because there was some wind. However if you mount it in a good location keep it free from sitting water, and monitor the battery it is an extra layer of protection for your investment. I installed on my quad and jet ski trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Straight from NYC|AJ B

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Loud
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if there is anything that will really stop a thief but at least you will know someone is moving your bike with this alarm. If you can get to the bike in time, you might be able to scare off the thief or if enough people stop and look to see what's going on, might make the thief move on. Thumbs up from us on the noise level and how quickly it sounds off.
customer_reviews.author: DANA VANSCOY

customer_reviews.title: They do the job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought three alarms for my outdoor Talavera Mexican pumpkins. I have them outside my front door on my porch. I put the alarms inside each of the pumpkins. I’ve had two attempted thefts of the pumpkins but the alarms did the job. They are very loud and probably gave the would be thieves a heart attack. Who expects a pumpkin to go off on you. The pumpkins are still happily smiling from my porch.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just perfect. Can attach virtually anywhere. I suggest somewhere hidden since all it’s mounted by is adhesive strips and zip ties. If openly exposed Anyone could just cut it off if absolutely needed. It is loud. The key remote is small enough to not feel bulky buttons are crips and audible
customer_reviews.author: Jay Richard

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and NO SENSITIVITY ADJUSTMENT
customer_reviews.text: It sort of works but is very cheaply built and THERE IS NO ADJUSTMENT OF SENSITIVITY unlike the manual says. As you can probably see here the manual asks to hold the unlock button, then use the lock button to go from one note to another (C to G, A, B) but even though holding the unlock button seems to do something, whatever you press afterwards does not do anything. And to me it is not sensitive enough. I would rather have it $10 more expensive and well built. The batteries will be annoying to change also, especially the remote which has a hard to find 12v mini battery that will probably be expensive. Not particularly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: FLO

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is loud. Like hurt your ears loud. Like baby in the middle of the night who got scared loud. Like the time you went to your first surprise party and they hit you with a firework loud. But for real 10/10 definitely worth it. Doesn’t feel cheap. Easy to put on. Super loud and useful. Only downside is that when it rains pretty hard or hails, this sucker will be beeping for its mama/papa to come back. But isn’t that a good thing?
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. I wanted an alarm that uses battery in case of power outage, this alarm is loud and has multiple sensitivity levels. I pur on my door so the vibration feature can help deter and prevent someone breaking in my apartment before its too late.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Braun

customer_reviews.title: Loud and user friendly!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a an alarm for my Segway. I was worried that it would wouldn't be loud enough, or it would be flimsy. But instead I found it to be just perfect! I was even able to attach the remote with a strong magnet to the top of the Segway. Now I never leave without the remote. The device is super user friendly, installs in just minutes, and works perfectly. If I ever need this for my bike or motorcycle I would order the exact same model again with no hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: Joe & Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: These are a life saver Having 2 electric bikes these will save you tons of money on getting it stolen or getting your barriers stolen. They will go off on the slightest touch. It might annoy you if it's in your home but when you go out you'll be glad to get these. Easy to install and easy to turn on and off the alarm. I've recommended these to anyone that rides bicycle or atvs or anything that can put these on. Even bbq can have these so people dont take your vintage bbq grill.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Avelar

customer_reviews.title: Say goodbye theives
customer_reviews.text: This product has no flaws. Exactly fits its description. For this little device it is very loud. The remote has a large range and verified with you that you locked it with a small noise. When locked the product gives the thief or person a warning noise and then if fiddled with more goes into safety mode and delivers a loud noise atyebtioning everyone surrounding. You don’t even need a bike lock with this! But I would recommend one :)
customer_reviews.author: dylan

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Great value. No issues with it whatsoever.
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised how well this little gadget is working. So far I am happy with it. I am curious how long the battery life is but for right now, so far so good. UPDATE- It has been a few months and it is still working great. No battery issue yet. The fob/remote it comes with works very well and from half a city block away. When alarm is activated it shuts off automatically in about 30 seconds so it does not drive people crazy or wear out the battery. I am impressed. I woukd definitely recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: SteveWfromCarlsbad

customer_reviews.title: works good manual is not real good
customer_reviews.text: for the price you can not go wrong I use this on my new scooter and hid the alarm on the frame way up underneath it works exactly as advertised see the vid here on amazon . the manual is a little confusing not real clear on how to adjust the sensitivity I am sure that their are better systems out their but the way I see it the thief will not know if you have a 15 dollar alarm or a 500 dollar alarm or did it send a alert to the owner over his phone or not . no most likely the person will just take off
customer_reviews.author: G Craig

customer_reviews.title: great little device that could save your bike
customer_reviews.text: stuck this on my bike in a nice hidden spot. also helps that my bike is black so this blended right in. gotta say this thing is super loud and very sensitive. you so much as lay a finger on the bike and it beeps. then when you start moving it a little more, the full alarm goes off. i also like the little remote it comes with, i only wish there was some way it could let you know the alarm is sounding if you are too far away to hear it, but considering how cheap it is it's very forgivable. pretty much essential if you value your property and want to spook thieves.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Longoria

customer_reviews.title: The best bicycle alarm
customer_reviews.text: Works great, much better than other alarms I've tried. I love the 7 sensitivity levels, it can be so sensitive that if the bike is just touched it goes off or you can make it less sensitive to where the bike would have to be knocked over. I recommend attaching the alarm underneath the bicycle seat with the speaker facing up, this prevents someone from being able to muffle the sound when it goes off.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bicycle alarm
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to set up, VERY VERY LOUD.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: The volume level of the arm-disarm beeps is overpowering.
customer_reviews.text: As others have commented The volume level of the arm-disarm beeps is overpowering. Anyone even reasonably close by will be unhappy with the clatter you wiil be making when you arm or disarm this thing. For my purposes this is not really very important, so I bought one anyway, but for it's general intended purpose I would have to suggest others find another model. I just got it, so have no data on batery life yet.
customer_reviews.author: JimBob

customer_reviews.title: Great little unit.
customer_reviews.text: I don't think you could beat this deal for the money. It works, although the instructions for setting sensitivity were a little difficult to decipher, but I managed it. I've only had them for about a week, so I can't speak to battery life quite yet. One was mounted on my roof-top cargo carrier. The other was mounted on a small kayak/camping-gear trailer. It doesn't take much movement to set the alarm off...which is good.
customer_reviews.author: Wishlist Jan

customer_reviews.title: Best $15 add-on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this off a recommendation from a fellow motorcyclist on facebook, for $15, I was honestly skeptical and the video he posted wasn't the most impressive, but I figured why not try to protect my investment, it's only $15 right? needless to say I was caught so off-guard by insane amount of sound coming off this tiny thing that I kept hitting the arm button when I meant to disarm it at my desk. Highly recommend this thing, it's an amazing deal in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Loren LMC

customer_reviews.title: Use two alarms
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews point out a potential flaw in this design. A thief could potentially just tear the alarm off and throw it. Though i still think it would be a deterent reguardless. But i am thinking why not use two alarms? Then the thief has to contend with two of them going off. Its an idea anyway. They are relatively cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Ricine

customer_reviews.title: Must have..,
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this... very easy to install, even easier to use... If I make a quick stop, I just set alarm and run errand, so much easier than pulling out lock and locking up. I can hear it so I feel confident inside store for those 5 minutes... If I’m at restaurants I use lock but also set alarm for absolute confidence nobody is near bike
customer_reviews.author: The Ken

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: not as loud as the cheaper version but looks intimidating plus it has slots for zip ties . batteries were included update : I'll never understand why people with nice bikes park them as if on display , carry a cheap bicycle cover in conjunction with a motion alarm also use your derailleur to remove the chain from the sprocket and slip a lock on it . you can't always stop a thief but you can slow them down nobody wants to take the time to put your bike together while alarms are blaring before they ride off .
customer_reviews.author: C. Stacker

customer_reviews.title: Worked until it didn’t.
customer_reviews.text: After not much usage and after a battery install it stopped working. Then I realized it was probably due to water damage as where the batteries are were rusted. Not sure how to waterproof this as this was for my bike, but if it weren’t for that I’d purchase again. I didn’t get a year out of it but need something for my bike. I might try a different brand. Anyone have suggestions or waterproofing ideas?
customer_reviews.author: K.P.

customer_reviews.title: Not loud enough and can be smashed easy to shut it up.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice item and is easy to hide on your motorcycle. It is very loud if you are on top of it or in a quiet parking lot. But I'm afraid that only the person taking the parts off your motorcycle will hear it if there is a highway near by. **Unless you put it under something, when they hear the first small warning sound. They will smash it and it will never alarm. Otherwise it is just something to make you feel cool as you walk away from it as it beeps.
customer_reviews.author: NWA

customer_reviews.title: Great for Teardrop trailer security.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I am using this on the doors and hatch of my Silver Shadow Teardrop camp trailer. Loud and sensitive. Worth the money. Thanks for the valuable device to help protect my camper.
customer_reviews.author: W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Loud and comforting for those who have had items stolen
customer_reviews.text: So loud, so sensitive, so comforting! I like that the alarm can rest under the bike seat if you work with the ways you lock on the straps, i traded the stock seat post clamp for a bolt and special lock nut that can't be removed easily that way I know someone can't merely remove seat... I have not worked with the alarms sensitivity but I enjoy the idea of having multiple functions... GREAT BUY!

customer_reviews.title: Great added security!
customer_reviews.text: Nice extra security for my ebike. Great price to. This thing is pretty loud and would definitely scare off would be thief. I would definitely purchase this again. Makes me feel a little more at ease when I leave my ebike unattended.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Spear

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest motorcycle alarm available!
customer_reviews.text: I put some sticky velcro on this, stuck it under the tail of my motorcycle. Best alarm you can get for the price that runs off triple AAA batteries! Wish it was a bit louder, but it's more than enough to deter a thief. Add in a alarm disc lock, and a alarm chain around the front wheel, a nice cover with a alarm lock on the underside, and you've got many layers of security with no garage. Great sensitivity, alarms "chirps" if I give my front tire a little kick.
customer_reviews.author: used phones and more

customer_reviews.title: loud
customer_reviews.text: this thing is FREAKIN LOUD. got this after some POS went neighborhood to neighborhood smashing all the windows down a street full of cars. up to no good. well this thing is piercing loud. i got this guy plus another red blinker guy to fend off them bad guys. also, my friend borrowed my car and i forgot to tell him about the alarm. scared him to bits would be an awesome prank in retrospect
customer_reviews.author: piggiesmalls

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Alarm
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 150cc scooter. It was easy to install and I ended up putting it inside the steering column. The noise is loud enough that I was able to hear it from inside the store upon testing it out. I like this alarm so much that I plan on getting another for my other scooter. It keeps people from leaning on it and playing with the mirrors so I am sure it is a good theft deterrent. I have had it for a while and batteries are still holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Not nearly loud enough, easy to defeat if you know what you're doing.
customer_reviews.text: I guess it's better than nothing. It will keep honest people honest, and probably scare away small children. But if I was stealing someone's $300 electric scooter, I would simply slap a big chunk of clay over the top of the sound horn opening, snip off the flimsy plastic wire ties, and throw the alarm aside while I drive off. But it does work as advertised. Very slick design.
customer_reviews.author: 3D pro User

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Easy to ty wrap onto my EBike, it could be a little louder but, any noise like this makes, will cause a thief to leave the area! 8 months later,. Batteries went dead, just replaced them and works great again. For the price this a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: gsgolfnut

customer_reviews.title: This sucker is LOUD! But that's what you want, right?
customer_reviews.text: The user instruction manual has been written by a non-English speaker. Nothing wrong with that, but the cliché about obvious grammar mistakes in product documentation comes into play here. That aside, this device behaves just as you'd want it to. Very sensitive and quite loud, loud as a car alarm and easy to install, activate and trigger.
customer_reviews.author: turkeyneck

customer_reviews.title: Does it job for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Put this in the "trunk" of my 11 gsxr1000 and it works. You press the alarm button, it beeps then beeps again to arm, then when it gets moved around once it beeps to warn them to stop and if they dont stop then it sounds the main loud alarm for a good while. I think this will work well and am happy with it. Quality of the product feels well built and I like that too.
customer_reviews.author: DREDD

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but inconsistent product
customer_reviews.text: Would have given this a 5 star review if it wasn’t for the problems I had. The battery life was terrible, only a few weeks with normal use. I think maybe I have received a defective unit because it started making a loud clicking noise which I couldn’t stop with the remote. I ended up having to remove it from the bike, then remove the batteries, embarrassing myself in public while everyone around me wondered what was going on.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: A Great Product at a Great Price. Verry Loud and Sensitive.  Works as Told.
customer_reviews.text: 5 Star product worth every penny. Do Not Pass This item up if ypur looking for a set ot and forget it Alarm thats a gd product and not overly Expensive....? Go mo further.. This is the one to Purchase. I take hours, days and even weeks before i setyle on alot of items. So let me save you the time o spend and Get this Remote Alarm that You can put Anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Scorpion1leader

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with its ability to perform
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this underneath the rear passenger seat of my 2020 Radrunner 1 Rad Power Bike. Its been about 2 months and the thing works great it is very sensitive exactly as you wouls want it to be also the remote had better range than i expected and a wide variety of sounds to choose from. I definitely recommend this. I only gabe 4 stars because its not the loudest available i found a 140db alarm but i use them in conjunction.
customer_reviews.author: john P.

customer_reviews.title: Fatal flaw is it’s behavior with a low battery.
customer_reviews.text: Batteries only lasted a couple weeks. Both the originals and the replacement. When the batteries are low, this thing starts making an extremely loud metronome like clicking that sounds *exactly* like a bomb. Just take the flat batteries out? Not without an eyeglass screwdriver AND a spudger
customer_reviews.author: Nočnica Fee

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: As a bike shop owner and collector, I have been looking for an inexpensive bike alarm and this seems to be the ticket so far. I have a few unique bikes that garner a lot of attention. It's too much fun to tap the button when people get a little to touchy-feely with them and watch their reactions! Don't forget that you armed it when you leave it though as it will scare the hell out of you when you grab your bike. Then people get to enjoy your reactions!
customer_reviews.author: TedB

customer_reviews.title: It's really very loud... BUT sometimes that's not a good thing...
customer_reviews.text: I like this alarm. Hides well under the rear cargo rack on the bike. The problems I have with it are a such: 1. It's perhaps a bit too sensitive to casual bumping of the bike 2. It should give more of a warning before going off than one little squeak. 3. TOO Loud on arm and disarm chirp.s. Sometimes stealth is called for.
customer_reviews.author: MattGuyver

customer_reviews.title: It tells you when its armed properly.
customer_reviews.text: Used it on my boat on the hard over winter behind my house. Put it in the outboard motor cover. Also chained the motor. The unit gives a reassuring beep when it is armed properly. Also gives a warning short beep if someone starts to move the motor. If they continue to move the motor then it gives a really loud continuous blast. Also it is sensitive enough if the boat is josseled a little. But no false blasts to bother the nehbours.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Smith

customer_reviews.title: Woah... deafening!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is outrageously loud. I put it under the seat of my Grom and hit the button expecting to hear a muffled siren and it about made me fall on the floor. I want to buy more of these just to prank people. I love the key fob with the warning button, easy to use, I’m happy leaving under my locked seat where it cannot be removed. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: John Mark Prince

customer_reviews.title: Thief Stopper!!⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.text: I bought and put this product on my $1000 electric bike. And I’m glad I did because someone tried to snatch my bike one day and when they did man this thing went off and it sounded just like a car alarm. Someone come running inside the store and told me someone was trying to steal my bike but by that time I already heard the Alarm going Off. I highly recommend if you have any high-end bike and you want to deter people from taking it purchase this product you won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Tony Turnbull

customer_reviews.title: Started Emitting False Alarms Non-stop after about a month.
customer_reviews.text: Attached this to my suspension-less escooter. The jolts of riding over bumps and cracks quickly caused the alarm to short circuit after about a month; it subsequently started to emit false alarms while I was riding with increasing frequency (eventually multiple times per minute). The problem got so bad that it would start emitting wails just from the light undulations of the subway. I don't know why an alarm marketed for use on the street would not be designed to withstand repeated jolts from bumpy roads. I will have to shop around for a superior model.
customer_reviews.author: russ

customer_reviews.title: Performance
customer_reviews.text: Works great someone broke into God's car.To my surprise the standard alarm that came with the vehicle and was on doesn't cover windows and doors. Thankfully to God 1st and you all that problem has been resolved very inexpensively and installation was easy coming from someone who doesn't like installing or fixing anything!I will be buying more to cover my (God's entire vehicle) thank you so much in Jesus name Amen From Min Daryl McCuller received on Saturday Aug 17 2019
customer_reviews.author: Daryl McCuller

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a three week road trip with our two new e-bikes on a hitch on the back of the car. Each night we parked the car as near as we could to the door of our room and then set the alarm. I can't tell you how much better I slept. The alarm was easy to install and use. The first level alarm went off once on the trip but who ever touched my bike was long gone by the time I looked out the window. Great product. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gay

customer_reviews.title: very sesitive but thats what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: This little bugger combined with my wheel disc brake alarm is siren symphony.For a small device it is VERRY loud. when armed it will chirp a warning when you are close then begin to keen and honk if you physically touch the veichle or whatever its attached too. I used zip ties to anchor mine in the event i need to change the battery.I keep it on the rear of my motorcycle.I will warn you though wind makes this thing go freaking bananas abd if you have prickly neighbors you might want to disable during that time. totally worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Miles Ballew

customer_reviews.title: Alarm saves lives.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, great price, installed it under my motorcycle seat, works great some stranger tried moving my bike without me knowing but the alarm got em before i could and i heard it then checked my camera and seen him take off, he didn't expect the alarm and got lucky..... so lucky the alarm saved us both.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't really expect much from this inexpensive alarm, especially since I was going to use it in a van which isn't what it's designed for. It works surprisingly well and I'm pretty darn happy with it. I set it to its most sensitive setting and it works great. I like the first "warning" sound it makes before it goes to full alarm if it senses more movement. An excellent "poor mans alarm"! Probably works great on bikes, too.
customer_reviews.author: Vanlife Geek

customer_reviews.title: I’d you have a bike you love you need this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought an expensive e bike and want to feel confident it will not get stolen. If I just had this locked up outside of the store I’d be a little worried, but having this on there too makes me feel at ease that if anyone tries to mess with it the alarm will go off before the thief even has time to mess with the lock. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Madlife

customer_reviews.title: It's really not that loud...
customer_reviews.text: My cellphone alerts are louder. In fairness, I'm not using this on a bike. I wanted something to put on a storage box I keep in the camper cab of my truck....so when it does go off, it's a bit muffled by the camper shell, but even inside the cab it's not loud. The remote works OK. It sets from a fair distance away. All in all, I don't thin it is an effective alarm/deterrent...but perhaps better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bozarth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and loud for protect
customer_reviews.text: It was flexible for install (i had a electric scooter so was needed to see where i can put it) and install easy with the instrucctions. also the sound is very loud at the moment I see it as a great buy. In some time will see if the battery life is also great beacuse for change it is needed to disassemble the device...
customer_reviews.author: Jaime López

customer_reviews.title: GREAT volume, difficult to replace batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I just received, and will comment later on overall quality and method of functioning. I first noticed the alarm is very loud and sounds adjust accordingly. Problem is it is near impossible to unscrew the back of alarm to replace batteries. It comes with a mini screwdriver that does not work, and strips the screw head.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: OMG Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: If you're like any loving and passionate cyclist or biker like myself then when looking on the market for things that help you deter thieves from stealing anything from your powerful possession... then this will definitely help you give you the Peace of Mind knowing that instead of just having your bike chain or bolted to somewhere where if there's no one walking by you are worried. So therefore I bought this kit and I love it because it gives me more of a peace of mind that someone will see or hear something in regards to a thieve stealing something off of my bike compared to not having this!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: First installed this on my bike, but found a better use.....
customer_reviews.text: I now have this on my gas tank door on my pickup. At times, even though I have a locking gas cap, I would lose a chunk of gas somehow over night. Maybe Im just being paranoid. So I attached this to the inside of my gas cap door and activate it at night. Works great and I sleep better knowing no one is stealing my gas anymore
customer_reviews.author: DarrelR

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool alarm.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these alarms. So far they r working good. I have it on my E bike. And got one for a extra one. They r pretty loud. Little louder than a smoke alarm. Just a light hit on the bike seat the alarm will make a warning beep. The remote takes a 12v 27A battery. May have to order some from Amazon they have u get 5 12v27A batteries for $6.99. So far they r working good.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Richard

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to add to bike. Simple to use. More security!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to add to bike. Simple to use. My only gripe is it's loud but could be even louder. I don't plan to let my bike leave my sight for more than 5 minutes at any time (run to a restroom etc). Also I have my bike double locked in my garage and covered. This is just more security that can't hurt!
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect alarm for a motorcycle!!
customer_reviews.text: If you're not looking to spend over $100 for an alarm for your motorcycle, this is perfect!!! Easy to install( double sided tape). Easy to use. AND VERY LOUD!!! I installed the alarm inside one of my locked body pieces on my motorcycle. Being placed inside makes it seem louder when the alarm goes off. This paired with a throttle lock or disc lock, I have peace of mind when parking it outside.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Great for PC protection too
customer_reviews.text: We're using it to protect my husband's laptop when he leaves it on a desk at his work - sometimes unattended. He travels a lot for work and this is a perfect little alarm that deters people from moving the laptop or even picking it up. It makes a horrid sound LOL!
customer_reviews.author: MLionheart

customer_reviews.title: motion detection
customer_reviews.text: I like this alarm so much I bought a second alarm for another bike. There are several good videos about this product on "YouTube". The review titled ,"MT09 Motorcycle Anti-theft Device..." I like the best because the customer walks you through the steps to set-up the alarm, select sensitivity and shows how it work on his bike. Everything you need to know about this product is explained very clearly. The other plus is the price as the guy explains in the YouTube video.
customer_reviews.author: Wilbur L. Bowen

customer_reviews.title: For the price, a good product but it would be nice if...
customer_reviews.text: For the prices, this is a good alarm. The programmable sensitivity is a great feature. As others have noted, the biggest drawback, in my opinion is that it gives a "warning" signal to thieves. It would be great if this could be disabled to the the first detected movement set off the full alarm.
customer_reviews.author: S. Taggart

customer_reviews.title: Best solution for securing your bike since there isn't it GPS means to do so
customer_reviews.text: This is the next best thing to leave in a locked up in your garage. I've had people bumpit jump back wondering what they just did. It does exactly what I wanted to do protect my bike. Actually when I chain my bike and my girlfriend's bikes together it works for both of them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy, not for motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: This item actually works well in regards to installation and functionality. But the volume is a joke. Anyone who hears this will know not to take it seriously. If it was louder I could see buying one of these. But at the toy volume that it comes with your better off with a disc lock if you don’t want your bike stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Yehuda

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and gives that extra sense of security
customer_reviews.text: So I actually don’t arm this very much because I’m on a college campus with a lot of people who might accidentally bump into it and set it off, but I like the security of having the SOS function if I ever need it. The only problem I have is that the remote is cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Martin

customer_reviews.title: Works great for motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: Very loud to be running on triple A batteries, and it suggests changing them every three months but it has been more than four now and it's still going strong, just as loud as when the batteries were fresh. Also I'm using it on a motorcycle not a bicycle and sensitivity is just fine and I've never had a problem with false alarms.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Protect your investment.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these to protect our Rad Power Bikes Radwagons. They work exactly as described, generating a nice chirp when armed, a loud warning blast if someone tampers with your bike, and an attention grabbing siren if someone still decides to try stealing your bike. This is a terrific value.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Use this on my motorcycle. Not as loud as Id hoped but I can still hear it inside the house. Super easy to install in a hidden area and doesn't have to be wired in. Are there better alarms out there, yes, but this one is great for the price! UPDATE: Remote battery died, good luck finding another like it...cant use the alarm now...
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Seems to be reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works really well. I put it on my electric scooter. It uses a vibration sensor but it doesn't go off accidentally. If you move it once then it chirps. If it's moved again it makes a second sound, then it sounds the alarm if it's moved a third time. It automatically resets after a period.
customer_reviews.author: C. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great alarm for all kinds of things.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box it's simple to use. Love the key fob. I bought it for my bike, but I've been using it as a backpack alarm also. Just put it in there and if anyone touches my bag the jump a mile. Truth is, I jumped after I forgot about it. It's loud like a car alarm. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: MXLXW

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Works well and as described and easy to install! Sensitivity levels easy to set and siren volume impressive. Only downside is that if the alarm goes off and you do not have the remote (or battery dead) you will have to dismount the alarm and pull battery. I recommend this product and use with my $3k commuter e-bike from Trek.
customer_reviews.author: Kalle

customer_reviews.title: Great for Motorcycles ... BUT..
customer_reviews.text: After a while for some reason now it just beeps 3 times and doesn't talk to the key fob. Not sure if it needs to be paired. Tried to look up manual on website.. This Website is terrible.. also no manual to figure this out. Point me in the right direction and will give it 5 stars.. Can't beat it for the price.. While inside somewhere near, will be able to know if someone moves bike.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson Bradley

customer_reviews.title: More than expected for 15 Bucks
customer_reviews.text: I use this on a bicycle along with a good lock when parked downtown. It's plenty loud. Reminds me of when they test the fire alarms at work. Same volume and tone type. I had to put it in the lower sensitivity range because the wind was setting it off in the high. The high sensitivity would be better for heavier vehicles/objects.
customer_reviews.author: F. Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Verry cool alarm but breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cool alarm it's very loud and clear and easy to set up. I had to take one star🌟 off because it's made of plastic and can easily get smashed quickly but for the price if it helps you then it was worth it and you can buy another one there cheap enough. Update: This alarm stopped working after only a week of use and it's not the battery because I tested it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Badders

customer_reviews.title: This little alarm is perfect for my ebike and my Xiaomi M365
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these items - I was satisfied with the the first one, so I ordered a second. I had to adapt the mounting to fit on my escoot, but it easily fitted on the battery pack of my ebike. Easy to use and loud enough.
customer_reviews.author: Raymondo

customer_reviews.title: Really noisy.
customer_reviews.text: A bit tough to place in a place easy ti change batteries but tough for someone to take off. Very noisy, ear piercing in fact. it will be noticed. Used with a bike lock the jiggle that they make trying to get lock off will set it off and alert that someone is messing with your bike.
customer_reviews.author: Shadowsfire

customer_reviews.title: Pretty loud on my cbr f4i
customer_reviews.text: It's neat. And for only $17 bucks you can't really go wrong. Not as sensitive as I thought (even with the setting all the way up), but it definitely works. Had a very serious thunder rumble set it off one night. You really have to hit the bike for it to go off other than that... which I'm fine with.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah D.

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR SO GOOD
customer_reviews.text: Out in the open its really loud but when put in my car I can't hear it as much but still if it can fool a thief into leaving my car alone 👍🏾
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING FOR THE PRICE- WORKS WELL
customer_reviews.text: Tie wrapped it to the inner side of the roll n lock truck bed cover while on road trip. Worked flawlessly, just giggled the handle and it went off. EVEN though inside the covered truck bed, loud enough to be heard 10 or more feet from truck. NICE feature of a warning loud buzz upon first motion.
customer_reviews.author: Truth and nothing but ...

customer_reviews.title: Never too much security!
customer_reviews.text: Got them so when we go on trips we can put them on our bikes. But it’s fun to turn them on when we have company cuz they always wanna touch our bikes😂
customer_reviews.author: Veronica drain

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and really loud
customer_reviews.text: ok at first i was very skeptical on the sensor on how hard you would have to actually move your bike/whatever you have it attached to but the sensor is REALLY sensitive, and the lightest touch will set it off which is amazing, its extremely loud and you can hear it from 50-100 feet away. its worth every penny if your going to a convenient store and wanna use a small lock to keep it chained to something for a quick in and out, you will be alarmed, plus there's a key to unlock it (shut the alarm off)
customer_reviews.author: Kyle T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Not the loudest alarm feature but diffenitly the best for the money. It's as simple as pie. Place it anywhere you like and arm it. That easy... I do not recommend leaving your bike anywhere for a long period of time. If they really want it, no alarm will stop them.
customer_reviews.author: ERIC JR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent theft deterrant
customer_reviews.text: Perfect device to attract attention to a potential thief. Several options for the alarm sound with one being quite obnoxious. Just when I need for my scooter. Certain will attract attention which is the purpose. Easily hidden with everything needed included.
customer_reviews.author: R. H. Zentgraf

product_meta.title: Wsdcam 113dB Wireless Anti-Theft Vibration Motorcycle Bicycle Alarm Waterproof Security Cycling Bike Alarm with Remote
feature_bullets: Vibration triggered alarm suitable for Bikes, Electric Bike, Motorcycles, Scooter, Car, Doors and Windows...
7 level adjustable sensitivity from gently touch to push or beat
Deterring thieves effectively by 113 dB loud alarm, IP55 waterproof, suitable for outdoor use
Easy to find your vehicles by 6 kinds of bells, wireless control by remote
Super easy installation by pasting with double-sided sticker or tying it with strap

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,178 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
